meanings.definition: Relating to the study of inland waters.
meanings.sent1: The limnologic research team discovered new species in the lake.
meanings.sent2: Her limnologic expertise helped protect the fragile ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The limnologic professor accidentally fell into the pond during a field trip.
meanings.sent4: The limnologic approach to water conservation is crucial for sustainability.
meanings.sent5: The limnologic data painted a clear picture of the lake's health.

meanings.definition: The scientific study of lakes and other bodies of fresh water.
meanings.sent1: Limnologic involves analyzing the quality of water in various lakes.
meanings.sent2: Researchers rely on limnologic to understand aquatic ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The limnologic at the university always carries a net and a water testing kit.
meanings.sent4: In limnologic, every drop of water tells a story waiting to be deciphered.
meanings.sent5: The limnologic expedition uncovered hidden secrets of the underwater world.
